units.title: Cluster cells and assign annotations
units.text: We clustered cells at high resolution in each dataset and assigned cell annotations based on known marker gene expression and differential expression between clusters (Supplementary Table 2).
units.rationale: This is an actionable protocol step involving clustering and annotation based on marker genes.

units.title: Establish hierarchical cell-type annotation
units.text: To assist with label-aware integration, we established a three-level hierarchical cell-type annotation: class (level 1), type (level 2) and subtype (level 3) (Extended Data Fig. 1).
units.rationale: This describes a structured protocol for defining cell-type hierarchy, essential for consistent annotation.

units.title: Assess and select data-integration method
units.text: To address batch effects and achieve a robust integration, we assessed 12 different data-integration methods using single-cell integration benchmarking14–21 (Extended Data Fig. 1a–d), and selected scPoli20,22 to generate an integrated embedding of all organoid cells.
units.rationale: This outlines a systematic protocol for evaluating and selecting an integration method based on benchmarking.

units.title: Reannotate integrated atlas based on cluster frequency
units.text: The integrated atlas was reannotated based on the most frequent cell type in each cluster, resulting in 5 cell classes at level 1, 48 cell types at level 2 and 51 cell subtypes at level 3 (Fig. 1f–h and Extended Data Fig. 1f).
units.rationale: This is a clear procedural step for refining annotations using cluster frequency data.

units.title: Compare organoid cell types with reference atlases
units.text: We identified major cell types from each adult and fetal tissue (Fig. 2a,b), and compared organoid cell types and states with primary atlas counterparts using neighborhood graph correlation24.
units.rationale: This describes a protocol for comparing organoid cell types against reference tissue atlases using a defined method.

units.title: Subset and reintegrate stem cells and enterocytes
units.text: We subsetted and reintegrated stem cells and enterocytes, and found that
units.rationale: This is a specific protocol step involving subsetting and reintegration of cell populations for focused analysis.

units.title: Perform pseudo-bulk analysis
units.text: Pseudo-bulk analysis using both raw and scPoli embedding on all organoid single-cell datasets revealed stem cell source and tissue type as primary drivers of variance (Extended Data Fig. 4).
units.rationale: This describes a standardized protocol for pseudo-bulk analysis using specific embeddings to assess variance drivers.
